name: Annotation.Svg

values.name: boundingBox
values.comment: Svg view of a bounding box with default style.

values.name: boundingBoxStyled
values.comment: Svg view of a bounding box with given style.

values.name: boundingBoxWithDetails
values.comment:
Svg detailed view of a bounding box.

Specify in the attributes the style of the bounding box.
Alternatively put a class attribute and set those in a style sheet (CSS).

values.name: contour
values.comment: Svg view of a contour with default style.

values.name: contourStyled
values.comment: Svg view of a contour with given style.

values.name: contourWithDetails
values.comment:
Svg detailed view of a contour.

Specify in the attributes the style of the contour.
Alternatively put a class attribute and set those in a style sheet (CSS).

values.name: point
values.comment: Svg view of a point with default style.

values.name: pointStyled
values.comment: Svg view of a point with given style.

values.name: pointWithDetails
values.comment:
Svg detailed view of a point.

Specify in the attributes the radius and styling of the circle
used to represent the point. Alternatively, put a class attribute
and set those in a style sheet (CSS).

values.name: stroke
values.comment: Svg view of a stroke with default style.

values.name: strokeStyled
values.comment: Svg view of a stroke with given style.

values.name: strokeWithDetails
values.comment:
Svg detailed view of a stroke.

Specify in the attributes the style of the stroke.
Alternatively put a class attribute and set those in a style sheet (CSS).

name: Annotation.Geometry.Outline
comment:
Create and manipulate freeline closed outlines.

@docs empty, addPoint

values.name: addPoint
values.comment: Add a point to an unfinished outline.

values.name: empty
values.comment: Create an empty outline.

values.name: fromCoordinates
values.comment: Create a Point with the given coordinates.

name: Annotation.Viewer

aliases.name: Viewer
aliases.type: { frame : OpenSolid.Geometry.Types.Frame2d , size : ( Float, Float ) , zoom : Float }

values.name: centerAt
values.comment: Recenter the viewing area at a given point.

values.name: default
values.comment: Default viewer.

values.name: fitImage
values.comment: Fit the view so that the image takes a certain percentage of its max viewable size.

values.name: getCenter
values.comment: Compute the center point of the viewer.

values.name: grabMove
values.comment: Translate the viewer frame opposite to the vector (used for "grab and move").

values.name: placeIn
values.comment:
Place an svg element in a viewer (apply the appropriate frame transformation).

This is for a user who wants to keep full control of the viewing process.
The result can then be used as a regular svg element.

It does not compute new coordinates of each svg element,
but simply embeds them in a group with the appropriate transformation.
So try using it only once, on a group containing all elements to insert.

For simple viewing, prefer using the `viewIn` function.

values.name: positionIn
values.comment: Transform coordinates of a point in the frame to their actual image coordinates.

values.name: setSize
values.comment: Reset size of the viewer.

values.name: setZoom
values.comment: Set the zoom value.

values.name: setZoomCentered
values.comment: Set zoom value while keeping the current center.

values.name: sizeIn
values.comment: Scale a size in the frame to its actual image size.

values.name: viewIn
values.comment:
View the generated svg annotations (bounding boxes, contours, ...)
in the viewer.

For display of the corresponding image in background,
simply group it with the annotations to generate a new Svg msg:

    Svg.g [] [ Image.viewSvg [] image, svgAnnotations ]

Be aware that the output of `viewIn` is an `svg` tag embedded in a `div` tag.
Embedding is performed to remedy some inconsistencies that may occur when
trying to get the dimensions of an `svg` tag with `clientWidth`.
(see [W3C spec](https://www.w3.org/TR/cssom-view-1/#dom-element-clientwidth):
"If the element has no associated CSS layout box
or if the CSS layout box is inline, return zero.")

For finer-grained control, prefer using `placeIn`.

values.name: viewInWithDetails
values.comment: Same as `viewIn` but html attributes can be added (like class, ...).
values.type: List (Html.Attribute msg) -> Annotation.Viewer.Viewer -> Svg.Svg msg -> Html.Html msg

values.name: zoomIn
values.comment: Zoom in (x2).

values.name: zoomOut
values.comment: Zoom out (x0.5).

name: Annotation.Geometry.Stroke
comment:
Create and manipulate freeline strokes.

@docs empty, addPoint, fromPoints, close

values.name: addPoint
values.comment: Add a point to an unfinished stroke.

values.name: close
values.comment:
Close a stroke (polyline) into a polygon.
The output can be interpreted as a `Contour` or `Outline`
since both are polygons.

values.name: empty
values.comment: Create an empty stroke.

values.name: fromPoints
values.comment: Create a stroke from a list of points

name: Annotation.Geometry.Contour
comment:
Create and manipulate polygonal contours.

@docs empty, addPoint, fromPoints

values.name: addPoint
values.comment: Add a point to an unfinished contour.

values.name: empty
values.comment: Create an empty contour.

values.name: fromPoints
values.comment: Create a contour from a list of points.

name: Annotation.Geometry.BoundingBox
comment:
Create and manipulate bounding boxes.

@docs fromPair, attributes

values.name: attributes
values.comment: Get the geometric svg attributes of a bounding box.

values.name: fromPair
values.comment: Create a bounding box from a pair of points.

name: Annotation.Style

types.name: Fill
types.comment:
Color of a fill.

A fill is either not visible, or of a given color and opacity.

types.name: Line
types.comment:
Styling of a line.

A line is either not visible,
or displayed with a stroke of given width and color.

types.name: Point
types.comment:
Styling of a point.

A point is either not visible,
or displayed as a colored disk of a given radius.

values.name: fillAttributes
values.comment: Get the svg attributes of a filling.

values.name: pointDefault
values.comment: Default style of a point.

values.name: strokeAttributes
values.comment: Get the svg attributes of a line.

values.name: strokeDefault
values.comment: Default style of a line.

name: Annotation.Geometry.Types
comment:
Types of the different elements usable for annotations.

In order to initialize an object of one of these types,
look into the corresponding module.
For example, to initialize a `Point`,
you will use the `Point.fromCoordinates` function from the `Point` module.

Rmq: *All those types are aliases of other types
from the [OpenSolid](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/opensolid/geometry/latest) package.
So you can easily extend functionalities based on the Opensolid functions.*

@docs Point, BoundingBox, Contour, Outline, Stroke
